  16. (* A pretty-printing facility and definition of formatters for 'parallel'
  17.    (i.e. unrelated or independent) pretty-printing on multiple out channels. *)

  19. (*
  20.    The pretty-printing engine internal data structures.
  21. *)

  23. ‌let id x = x

  25. (* A devoted type for sizes to avoid confusion
  26.    between sizes and mere integers. *)
  27. module Size : sig
  28.   type t

  30.   val to_int : t -> int
  31.   val of_int : int -> t
  32.   val zero : t
  33.   val unknown : t
  34.   val is_known : t -> bool
  35. end  = struct
  36. ‌  type t = int

  38. ‌  let to_int = id
  39. ‌  let of_int = id
  40. ‌  let zero = 0
  41. ‌  let unknown = -1
  42. ‌  let is_known n = n >= 0
  43. end



  47. (* The pretty-printing boxes definition:
  48.    a pretty-printing box is either
  49.    - hbox: horizontal box (no line splitting)
  50.    - vbox: vertical box (every break hint splits the line)
  51.    - hvbox: horizontal/vertical box
  52.      (the box behaves as an horizontal box if it fits on
  53.       the current line, otherwise the box behaves as a vertical box)
  54.    - hovbox: horizontal or vertical compacting box
  55.      (the box is compacting material, printing as much material as possible
  56.       on every lines)
  57.    - box: horizontal or vertical compacting box with enhanced box structure
  58.      (the box behaves as an horizontal or vertical box but break hints split
  59.       the line if splitting would move to the left)
  60. *)
  61. ‌type box_type = CamlinternalFormatBasics.block_type =
  62.   | Pp_hbox | Pp_vbox | Pp_hvbox | Pp_hovbox | Pp_box | Pp_fits


  65. (* The pretty-printing tokens definition:
  66.    are either text to print or pretty printing
  67.    elements that drive indentation and line splitting. *)
  68. ‌type pp_token =
  69.   | Pp_text of string          (* normal text *)
  70.   | Pp_break of {              (* complete break *)
  71.       fits: string * int * string;   (* line is not split *)
  72.       breaks: string * int * string; (* line is split *)
  73.     }
  74.   | Pp_tbreak of int * int     (* go to next tabulation *)
  75.   | Pp_stab                    (* set a tabulation *)
  76.   | Pp_begin of int * box_type (* beginning of a box *)
  77.   | Pp_end                     (* end of a box *)
  78.   | Pp_tbegin of tbox          (* beginning of a tabulation box *)
  79.   | Pp_tend                    (* end of a tabulation box *)
  80.   | Pp_newline                 (* to force a newline inside a box *)
  81.   | Pp_if_newline              (* to do something only if this very
  82.                                   line has been broken *)
  83.   | Pp_open_tag of stag         (* opening a tag name *)
  84.   | Pp_close_tag               (* closing the most recently open tag *)

  86. ‌and stag = ..

  88. ‌and tbox = Pp_tbox of int list ref  (* Tabulation box *)

  90. ‌type tag = string
  91. ‌type stag += String_tag of tag


  94. (* The pretty-printer queue:
  95.    pretty-printing material is not written in the output as soon as emitted;
  96.    instead, the material is simply recorded in the pretty-printer queue,
  97.    until the enclosing box has a known computed size and proper splitting
  98.    decisions can be made.

  100.    The pretty-printer queue contains formatting elements to be printed.
  101.    Each formatting element is a tuple (size, token, length), where
  102.    - length is the declared length of the token,
  103.    - size is effective size of the token when it is printed
  104.      (size is set when the size of the box is known, so that size of break
  105.       hints are definitive). *)
  106. ‌type pp_queue_elem = {
  107.   mutable size : Size.t;
  108.   token : pp_token;
  109.   length : int;
  110. }


  113. (* The pretty-printer queue definition. *)
  114. ‌type pp_queue = pp_queue_elem Queue.t

  116. (* The pretty-printer scanning stack. *)

  118. (* The pretty-printer scanning stack: scanning element definition. *)
  119. ‌type pp_scan_elem = {
  120.   left_total : int; (* Value of pp_left_total when the element was enqueued. *)
  121.   queue_elem : pp_queue_elem
  122. }

  124. (* The pretty-printer formatting stack:
  125.    the formatting stack contains the description of all the currently active
  126.    boxes; the pretty-printer formatting stack is used to split the lines
  127.    while printing tokens. *)

  129. (* The pretty-printer formatting stack: formatting stack element definition.
  130.    Each stack element describes a pretty-printing box. *)
  131. ‌type pp_format_elem = { box_type : box_type; width : int }

  133. (* The formatter definition.
  134.    Each formatter value is a pretty-printer instance with all its
  135.    machinery. *)
  136. ‌type formatter = {
  137.   (* The pretty-printer scanning stack. *)
  138.   pp_scan_stack : pp_scan_elem Stack.t;
  139.   (* The pretty-printer formatting stack. *)
  140.   pp_format_stack : pp_format_elem Stack.t;
  141.   pp_tbox_stack : tbox Stack.t;
  142.   (* The pretty-printer semantics tag stack. *)
  143.   pp_tag_stack : stag Stack.t;
  144.   pp_mark_stack : stag Stack.t;
  145.   (* Value of right margin. *)
  146.   mutable pp_margin : int;
  147.   (* Minimal space left before margin, when opening a box. *)
  148.   mutable pp_min_space_left : int;
  149.   (* Maximum value of indentation:
  150.      no box can be opened further. *)
  151.   mutable pp_max_indent : int;
  152.   (* Space remaining on the current line. *)
  153.   mutable pp_space_left : int;
  154.   (* Current value of indentation. *)
  155.   mutable pp_current_indent : int;
  156.   (* True when the line has been broken by the pretty-printer. *)
  157.   mutable pp_is_new_line : bool;
  158.   (* Total width of tokens already printed. *)
  159.   mutable pp_left_total : int;
  160.   (* Total width of tokens ever put in queue. *)
  161.   mutable pp_right_total : int;
  162.   (* Current number of open boxes. *)
  163.   mutable pp_curr_depth : int;
  164.   (* Maximum number of boxes which can be simultaneously open. *)
  165.   mutable pp_max_boxes : int;
  166.   (* Ellipsis string. *)
  167.   mutable pp_ellipsis : string;
  168.   (* Output function. *)
  169.   mutable pp_out_string : string -> int -> int -> unit;
  170.   (* Flushing function. *)
  171.   mutable pp_out_flush : unit -> unit;
  172.   (* Output of new lines. *)
  173.   mutable pp_out_newline : unit -> unit;
  174.   (* Output of break hints spaces. *)
  175.   mutable pp_out_spaces : int -> unit;
  176.   (* Output of indentation of new lines. *)
  177.   mutable pp_out_indent : int -> unit;
  178.   (* Are tags printed ? *)
  179.   mutable pp_print_tags : bool;
  180.   (* Are tags marked ? *)
  181.   mutable pp_mark_tags : bool;
  182.   (* Find opening and closing markers of tags. *)
  183.   mutable pp_mark_open_tag : stag -> string;
  184.   mutable pp_mark_close_tag : stag -> string;
  185.   mutable pp_print_open_tag : stag -> unit;
  186.   mutable pp_print_close_tag : stag -> unit;
  187.   (* The pretty-printer queue. *)
  188.   pp_queue : pp_queue;
  189. }


  192. (* The formatter specific tag handling functions. *)
  193. ‌type formatter_stag_functions = {
  194.   mark_open_stag : stag -> string;
  195.   mark_close_stag : stag -> string;
  196.   print_open_stag : stag -> unit;
  197.   print_close_stag : stag -> unit;
  198. }


  201. (* The formatter functions to output material. *)
  202. ‌type formatter_out_functions = {
  203.   out_string : string -> int -> int -> unit;
  204.   out_flush : unit -> unit;
  205.   out_newline : unit -> unit;
  206.   out_spaces : int -> unit;
  207.   out_indent : int -> unit;
  208. }


  211. (*

  213.   Auxiliaries and basic functions.

  215. *)

  217. (* Enter a token in the pretty-printer queue. *)
  218. ‌let pp_enqueue state token =
  219.   state.pp_right_total <- state.pp_right_total + token.length;
  220.   Queue.add token state.pp_queue


  223. ‌let pp_clear_queue state =
  224.   state.pp_left_total <- 1; state.pp_right_total <- 1;
  225.   Queue.clear state.pp_queue


  228. (* Pp_infinity: large value for default tokens size.

  230.    Pp_infinity is documented as being greater than 1e10; to avoid
  231.    confusion about the word 'greater', we choose pp_infinity greater
  232.    than 1e10 + 1; for correct handling of tests in the algorithm,
  233.    pp_infinity must be even one more than 1e10 + 1; let's stand on the
  234.    safe side by choosing 1.e10+10.

  236.    Pp_infinity could probably be 1073741823 that is 2^30 - 1, that is
  237.    the minimal upper bound for integers; now that max_int is defined,
  238.    this limit could also be defined as max_int - 1.

  240.    However, before setting pp_infinity to something around max_int, we
  241.    must carefully double-check all the integer arithmetic operations
  242.    that involve pp_infinity, since any overflow would wreck havoc the
  243.    pretty-printing algorithm's invariants. Given that this arithmetic
  244.    correctness check is difficult and error prone and given that 1e10
  245.    + 1 is in practice large enough, there is no need to attempt to set
  246.    pp_infinity to the theoretically maximum limit. It is not worth the
  247.    burden ! *)
  248. ‌let pp_infinity = 1000000010

  250. (* Output functions for the formatter. *)
  251. ‌let pp_output_string state s = state.pp_out_string s 0 (String.length s)
  252. and pp_output_newline state = state.pp_out_newline ()
  253. and pp_output_spaces state n = state.pp_out_spaces n
  254. and pp_output_indent state n = state.pp_out_indent n

  256. (* Format a textual token *)
  257. ‌let format_pp_text state size text =
  258.   state.pp_space_left <- state.pp_space_left - size;
  259.   pp_output_string state text;
  260.   state.pp_is_new_line <- false

  262. (* Format a string by its length, if not empty *)
  263. ‌let format_string state s =
  264.   if s <> "" then format_pp_text state (String.length s) s

  266. (* To format a break, indenting a new line. *)
  267. ‌let break_new_line state (before, offset, after) width =
  268.   format_string state before;
  269.   pp_output_newline state;
  270.   state.pp_is_new_line <- true;
  271.   let indent = state.pp_margin - width + offset in
  272.   (* Don't indent more than pp_max_indent. *)
  273.   let real_indent = Int.min state.pp_max_indent indent in
  274.   state.pp_current_indent <- real_indent;
  275.   state.pp_space_left <- state.pp_margin - state.pp_current_indent;
  276.   pp_output_indent state state.pp_current_indent;
  277.   format_string state after


  280. (* To force a line break inside a box: no offset is added. *)
  281. ‌let break_line state width = break_new_line state ("", 0, "") width

  283. (* To format a break that fits on the current line. *)
  284. ‌let break_same_line state (before, width, after) =
  285.   format_string state before;
  286.   state.pp_space_left <- state.pp_space_left - width;
  287.   pp_output_spaces state width;
  288.   format_string state after


  291. (* To indent no more than pp_max_indent, if one tries to open a box
  292.    beyond pp_max_indent, then the box is rejected on the left
  293.    by simulating a break. *)
  294. ‌let pp_force_break_line state =
  295.   match Stack.top_opt state.pp_format_stack with
  296.   | None -> pp_output_newline state
  297.   | Some { box_type; width } ->
  298.     if width > state.pp_space_left then
  299.       match box_type with
  300.       | Pp_fits | Pp_hbox -> ()
  301.       | Pp_vbox | Pp_hvbox | Pp_hovbox | Pp_box -> break_line state width


  304. (* To skip a token, if the previous line has been broken. *)
  305. ‌let pp_skip_token state =
  306.   match Queue.take_opt state.pp_queue with
  307.   | None -> () (* print_if_newline must have been the last printing command *)
  308.   | Some { size; length; _ } ->
  309.     state.pp_left_total <- state.pp_left_total - length;
  310.     state.pp_space_left <- state.pp_space_left + Size.to_int size


  313. (*

  315.   The main pretty printing functions.

  317. *)

  319. (* Formatting a token with a given size. *)
  320. ‌let format_pp_token state size = function

  322.   | Pp_text s ->
  323.     format_pp_text state size s

  325.   | Pp_begin (off, ty) ->
  326.     let insertion_point = state.pp_margin - state.pp_space_left in
  327.     if insertion_point > state.pp_max_indent then
  328.       (* can not open a box right there. *)
  329.       begin pp_force_break_line state end;
  330.     let width = state.pp_space_left - off in
  331.     let box_type =
  332.       match ty with
  333.       | Pp_vbox -> Pp_vbox
  334.       | Pp_hbox | Pp_hvbox | Pp_hovbox | Pp_box | Pp_fits ->
  335.         if size > state.pp_space_left then ty else Pp_fits in
  336.     Stack.push { box_type; width } state.pp_format_stack

  338.   | Pp_end ->
  339.     Stack.pop_opt state.pp_format_stack |> ignore

  341.   | Pp_tbegin (Pp_tbox _ as tbox) ->
  342.     Stack.push tbox state.pp_tbox_stack

  344.   | Pp_tend ->
  345.     Stack.pop_opt state.pp_tbox_stack |> ignore

  347.   | Pp_stab ->
  348.     begin match Stack.top_opt state.pp_tbox_stack with
  349.     | None -> () (* No open tabulation box. *)
  350.     | Some (Pp_tbox tabs) ->
  351.       let rec add_tab n = function
  352.         | [] -> [n]
  353.         | x :: l as ls -> if n < x then n :: ls else x :: add_tab n l in
  354.       tabs := add_tab (state.pp_margin - state.pp_space_left) !tabs
  355.     end

  357.   | Pp_tbreak (n, off) ->
  358. ‌    let insertion_point = state.pp_margin - state.pp_space_left in
  359.     begin match Stack.top_opt state.pp_tbox_stack with
  360.     | None -> () (* No open tabulation box. *)
  361.     | Some (Pp_tbox tabs) ->
  362. ‌      let tab =
  363.         match !tabs with
  364.         | [] -> insertion_point
  365.         | first :: _ ->
  366.           let rec find = function
  367.             | head :: tail ->
  368.               if head >= insertion_point then head else find tail
  369.             | [] -> first in
  370.           find !tabs in
  371. ‌      let offset = tab - insertion_point in
  372.       if offset >= 0
  373.       then break_same_line state ("", offset + n, "")
  374.       else break_new_line state ("", tab + off, "") state.pp_margin
  375.     end

  377.   | Pp_newline ->
  378.     begin match Stack.top_opt state.pp_format_stack with
  379.     | None -> pp_output_newline state (* No open box. *)
  380.     | Some { width; _} -> break_line state width
  381.     end

  383.   | Pp_if_newline ->
  384.     if state.pp_current_indent != state.pp_margin - state.pp_space_left
  385.     then pp_skip_token state

  387.   | Pp_break { fits; breaks } ->
  388. ‌    let before, off, _ = breaks in
  389.     begin match Stack.top_opt state.pp_format_stack with
  390.     | None -> () (* No open box. *)
  391.     | Some { box_type; width } ->
  392.       begin match box_type with
  393.       | Pp_hovbox ->
  394.         if size + String.length before > state.pp_space_left
  395.         then break_new_line state breaks width
  396.         else break_same_line state fits
  397.       | Pp_box ->
  398.         (* Have the line just been broken here ? *)
  399.         if state.pp_is_new_line then break_same_line state fits else
  400.         if size + String.length before > state.pp_space_left
  401.           then break_new_line state breaks width else
  402.         (* break the line here leads to new indentation ? *)
  403.         if state.pp_current_indent > state.pp_margin - width + off
  404.         then break_new_line state breaks width
  405.         else break_same_line state fits
  406.       | Pp_hvbox -> break_new_line state breaks width
  407.       | Pp_fits -> break_same_line state fits
  408.       | Pp_vbox -> break_new_line state breaks width
  409.       | Pp_hbox -> break_same_line state fits
  410.       end
  411.     end

  413.    | Pp_open_tag tag_name ->
  414. ‌     let marker = state.pp_mark_open_tag tag_name in
  415.      pp_output_string state marker;
  416.      Stack.push tag_name state.pp_mark_stack

  418.    | Pp_close_tag ->
  419.      begin match Stack.pop_opt state.pp_mark_stack with
  420.      | None -> () (* No more tag to close. *)
  421.      | Some tag_name ->
  422. ‌       let marker = state.pp_mark_close_tag tag_name in
  423.        pp_output_string state marker
  424.      end


  427. (* Print if token size is known else printing is delayed.
  428.    Printing is delayed when the text waiting in the queue requires
  429.    more room to format than exists on the current line. *)
  430. ‌let rec advance_left state =
  431.   match Queue.peek_opt state.pp_queue with
  432.   | None -> () (* No tokens to print *)
  433.   | Some { size; token; length } ->
  434.     let pending_count = state.pp_right_total - state.pp_left_total in
  435.     if Size.is_known size || pending_count >= state.pp_space_left then begin
  436.       Queue.take state.pp_queue |> ignore; (* Not empty: we peek into it *)
  437.       let size = if Size.is_known size then Size.to_int size else pp_infinity in
  438.       format_pp_token state size token;
  439.       state.pp_left_total <- length + state.pp_left_total;
  440.       (advance_left [@tailcall]) state
  441.     end


  444. (* To enqueue a token : try to advance. *)
  445. ‌let enqueue_advance state tok = pp_enqueue state tok; advance_left state


  448. (* To enqueue strings. *)
  449. ‌let enqueue_string_as state size s =
  450.   enqueue_advance state { size; token = Pp_text s; length = Size.to_int size }


  453. let enqueue_string state s =
  454.   enqueue_string_as state (Size.of_int (String.length s)) s


  457. (* Routines for scan stack
  458.    determine size of boxes. *)

  460. (* The scan_stack is never empty. *)
  461. let initialize_scan_stack stack =
  462.   Stack.clear stack;
  463.   let queue_elem = { size = Size.unknown; token = Pp_text ""; length = 0 } in
  464.   Stack.push { left_total = -1; queue_elem } stack

  466. (* Setting the size of boxes on scan stack:
  467.    if ty = true then size of break is set else size of box is set;
  468.    in each case pp_scan_stack is popped.

  470.    Note:
  471.    Pattern matching on scan stack is exhaustive, since scan_stack is never
  472.    empty.
  473.    Pattern matching on token in scan stack is also exhaustive,
  474.    since scan_push is used on breaks and opening of boxes. *)
  475. let set_size state ty =
  476.   match Stack.top_opt state.pp_scan_stack with
  477.   | None -> () (* scan_stack is never empty. *)
  478.   | Some { left_total; queue_elem } ->
  479.     let size = Size.to_int queue_elem.size in
  480.     (* test if scan stack contains any data that is not obsolete. *)
  481.     if left_total < state.pp_left_total then
  482.       initialize_scan_stack state.pp_scan_stack
  483.     else
  484.       match queue_elem.token with
  485.       | Pp_break _ | Pp_tbreak (_, _) ->
  486.         if ty then begin
  487.           queue_elem.size <- Size.of_int (state.pp_right_total + size);
  488.           Stack.pop_opt state.pp_scan_stack |> ignore
  489.         end
  490.       | Pp_begin (_, _) ->
  491.         if not ty then begin
  492.           queue_elem.size <- Size.of_int (state.pp_right_total + size);
  493.           Stack.pop_opt state.pp_scan_stack |> ignore
  494.         end
  495.       | Pp_text _ | Pp_stab | Pp_tbegin _ | Pp_tend | Pp_end
  496.       | Pp_newline | Pp_if_newline | Pp_open_tag _ | Pp_close_tag ->
  497.         () (* scan_push is only used for breaks and boxes. *)


  500. (* Push a token on pretty-printer scanning stack.
  501.    If b is true set_size is called. *)
  502. ‌let scan_push state b token =
  503.   pp_enqueue state token;
  504.   if b then set_size state true;
  505.   let elem = { left_total = state.pp_right_total; queue_elem = token } in
  506.   Stack.push elem state.pp_scan_stack


  509. (* To open a new box :
  510.    the user may set the depth bound pp_max_boxes
  511.    any text nested deeper is printed as the ellipsis string. *)
  512. let pp_open_box_gen state indent br_ty =
  513.   state.pp_curr_depth <- state.pp_curr_depth + 1;
  514.   if state.pp_curr_depth < state.pp_max_boxes then
  515.     let size = Size.of_int (- state.pp_right_total) in
  516.     let elem = { size; token = Pp_begin (indent, br_ty); length = 0 } in
  517.     scan_push state false elem else
  518.   if state.pp_curr_depth = state.pp_max_boxes
  519.   then enqueue_string state state.pp_ellipsis


  522. (* The box which is always open. *)
  523. let pp_open_sys_box state = pp_open_box_gen state 0 Pp_hovbox

  525. (* Close a box, setting sizes of its sub boxes. *)
  526. let pp_close_box state () =
  527.   if state.pp_curr_depth > 1 then
  528.   begin
  529.     if state.pp_curr_depth < state.pp_max_boxes then
  530.     begin
  531.       pp_enqueue state { size = Size.zero; token = Pp_end; length = 0 };
  532.       set_size state true; set_size state false
  533.     end;
  534.     state.pp_curr_depth <- state.pp_curr_depth - 1;
  535.   end


  538. (* Open a tag, pushing it on the tag stack. *)
  539. ‌let pp_open_stag state tag_name =
  540.   if state.pp_print_tags then
  541.   begin
  542.     Stack.push tag_name state.pp_tag_stack;
  543.     state.pp_print_open_tag tag_name
  544.   end;
  545.   if state.pp_mark_tags then
  546.     let token = Pp_open_tag tag_name in
  547.     pp_enqueue state { size = Size.zero; token; length = 0 }


  550. (* Close a tag, popping it from the tag stack. *)
  551. let pp_close_stag state () =
  552.   if state.pp_mark_tags then
  553.     pp_enqueue state { size = Size.zero; token = Pp_close_tag; length = 0 };
  554.   if state.pp_print_tags then
  555.     match Stack.pop_opt state.pp_tag_stack with
  556.     | None -> () (* No more tag to close. *)
  557.     | Some tag_name ->
  558.       state.pp_print_close_tag tag_name

  560. let pp_set_print_tags state b = state.pp_print_tags <- b
  561. let pp_set_mark_tags state b = state.pp_mark_tags <- b
  562. let pp_get_print_tags state () = state.pp_print_tags
  563. let pp_get_mark_tags state () = state.pp_mark_tags
  564. let pp_set_tags state b =
  565.   pp_set_print_tags state b; pp_set_mark_tags state b


  568. (* Handling tag handling functions: get/set functions. *)
  569. let pp_get_formatter_stag_functions state () = {
  570.   mark_open_stag = state.pp_mark_open_tag;
  571.   mark_close_stag = state.pp_mark_close_tag;
  572.   print_open_stag = state.pp_print_open_tag;
  573.   print_close_stag = state.pp_print_close_tag;
  574. }


  577. let pp_set_formatter_stag_functions state {
  578.      mark_open_stag = mot;
  579.      mark_close_stag = mct;
  580.      print_open_stag = pot;
  581.      print_close_stag = pct;
  582.   } =
  583.   state.pp_mark_open_tag <- mot;
  584.   state.pp_mark_close_tag <- mct;
  585.   state.pp_print_open_tag <- pot;
  586.   state.pp_print_close_tag <- pct


  589. (* Initialize pretty-printer. *)
  590. let pp_rinit state =
  591.   pp_clear_queue state;
  592.   initialize_scan_stack state.pp_scan_stack;
  593.   Stack.clear state.pp_format_stack;
  594.   Stack.clear state.pp_tbox_stack;
  595.   Stack.clear state.pp_tag_stack;
  596.   Stack.clear state.pp_mark_stack;
  597.   state.pp_current_indent <- 0;
  598.   state.pp_curr_depth <- 0;
  599.   state.pp_space_left <- state.pp_margin;
  600.   pp_open_sys_box state

  602. let clear_tag_stack state =
  603.   Stack.iter (fun _ -> pp_close_stag state ()) state.pp_tag_stack


  606. (* Flushing pretty-printer queue. *)
  607. let pp_flush_queue state ~end_with_newline =
  608.   clear_tag_stack state;
  609.   while state.pp_curr_depth > 1 do
  610.     pp_close_box state ()
  611.   done;
  612.   state.pp_right_total <- pp_infinity;
  613.   advance_left state;
  614.   if end_with_newline then pp_output_newline state;
  615.   pp_rinit state

  617. (*

  619.   Procedures to format values and use boxes.

  621. *)

  623. (* To format a string. *)
  624. let pp_print_as_size state size s =
  625.   if state.pp_curr_depth < state.pp_max_boxes
  626.   then enqueue_string_as state size s


  629. let pp_print_as state isize s =
  630.   pp_print_as_size state (Size.of_int isize) s


  633. let pp_print_string state s =
  634.   pp_print_as state (String.length s) s

  636. let pp_print_bytes state s =
  637.   pp_print_as state (Bytes.length s) (Bytes.to_string s)

  639. (* To format an integer. *)
  640. let pp_print_int state i = pp_print_string state (Int.to_string i)

  642. (* To format a float. *)
  643. let pp_print_float state f = pp_print_string state (string_of_float f)

  645. (* To format a boolean. *)
  646. let pp_print_bool state b = pp_print_string state (string_of_bool b)

  648. (* To format a char. *)
  649. let pp_print_char state c =
  650.   pp_print_as state 1 (String.make 1 c)


  653. (* Opening boxes. *)
  654. let pp_open_hbox state () = pp_open_box_gen state 0 Pp_hbox
  655. and pp_open_vbox state indent = pp_open_box_gen state indent Pp_vbox

  657. and pp_open_hvbox state indent = pp_open_box_gen state indent Pp_hvbox
  658. and pp_open_hovbox state indent = pp_open_box_gen state indent Pp_hovbox
  659. and pp_open_box state indent = pp_open_box_gen state indent Pp_box


  662. (* Printing queued text.

  664.    [pp_print_flush] prints all pending items in the pretty-printer queue and
  665.    then flushes the low level output device of the formatter to actually
  666.    display printing material.

  668.    [pp_print_newline] behaves as [pp_print_flush] after printing an additional
  669.    new line. *)
  670. let pp_print_newline state () =
  671.   pp_flush_queue state ~end_with_newline:true; state.pp_out_flush ()
  672. and pp_print_flush state () =
  673.   pp_flush_queue state ~end_with_newline:false; state.pp_out_flush ()


  676. (* To get a newline when one does not want to close the current box. *)
  677. let pp_force_newline state () =
  678.   if state.pp_curr_depth < state.pp_max_boxes then
  679.     enqueue_advance state { size = Size.zero; token = Pp_newline; length = 0 }


  682. (* To format something, only in case the line has just been broken. *)
  683. let pp_print_if_newline state () =
  684.   if state.pp_curr_depth < state.pp_max_boxes then
  685.     enqueue_advance state
  686.       { size = Size.zero; token = Pp_if_newline; length = 0 }


  689. (* Generalized break hint that allows printing strings before/after
  690.    same-line offset (width) or new-line offset *)
  691. let pp_print_custom_break state ~fits ~breaks =
  692.   let before, width, after = fits in
  693.   if state.pp_curr_depth < state.pp_max_boxes then
  694.     let size = Size.of_int (- state.pp_right_total) in
  695.     let token = Pp_break { fits; breaks } in
  696.     let length = String.length before + width + String.length after in
  697.     let elem = { size; token; length } in
  698.     scan_push state true elem

  700. (* Printing break hints:
  701.    A break hint indicates where a box may be broken.
  702.    If line is broken then offset is added to the indentation of the current
  703.    box else (the value of) width blanks are printed. *)
  704. let pp_print_break state width offset =
  705.   pp_print_custom_break state
  706.     ~fits:("", width, "") ~breaks:("", offset, "")


  709. (* Print a space :
  710.    a space is a break hint that prints a single space if the break does not
  711.    split the line;
  712.    a cut is a break hint that prints nothing if the break does not split the
  713.    line. *)
  714. let pp_print_space state () = pp_print_break state 1 0
  715. and pp_print_cut state () = pp_print_break state 0 0


  718. (* Tabulation boxes. *)
  719. let pp_open_tbox state () =
  720.   state.pp_curr_depth <- state.pp_curr_depth + 1;
  721.   if state.pp_curr_depth < state.pp_max_boxes then
  722.     let size = Size.zero in
  723.     let elem = { size; token = Pp_tbegin (Pp_tbox (ref [])); length = 0 } in
  724.     enqueue_advance state elem


  727. (* Close a tabulation box. *)
  728. let pp_close_tbox state () =
  729.   if state.pp_curr_depth > 1 then
  730.   begin
  731.    if state.pp_curr_depth < state.pp_max_boxes then
  732.      let elem = { size = Size.zero; token = Pp_tend; length = 0 } in
  733.      enqueue_advance state elem;
  734.      state.pp_curr_depth <- state.pp_curr_depth - 1
  735.   end


  738. (* Print a tabulation break. *)
  739. ‌let pp_print_tbreak state width offset =
  740.   if state.pp_curr_depth < state.pp_max_boxes then
  741.     let size = Size.of_int (- state.pp_right_total) in
  742.     let elem = { size; token = Pp_tbreak (width, offset); length = width } in
  743.     scan_push state true elem


  746. let pp_print_tab state () = pp_print_tbreak state 0 0

  748. let pp_set_tab state () =
  749.   if state.pp_curr_depth < state.pp_max_boxes then
  750.     let elem = { size = Size.zero; token = Pp_stab; length = 0 } in
  751.     enqueue_advance state elem


  754. (*

  756.   Procedures to control the pretty-printers

  758. *)

  760. (* Set_max_boxes. *)
  761. let pp_set_max_boxes state n = if n > 1 then state.pp_max_boxes <- n

  763. (* To know the current maximum number of boxes allowed. *)
  764. let pp_get_max_boxes state () = state.pp_max_boxes

  766. let pp_over_max_boxes state () = state.pp_curr_depth = state.pp_max_boxes

  768. (* Ellipsis. *)
  769. let pp_set_ellipsis_text state s = state.pp_ellipsis <- s
  770. and pp_get_ellipsis_text state () = state.pp_ellipsis


  773. (* To set the margin of pretty-printer. *)
  774. let pp_limit n =
  775.   if n < pp_infinity then n else pred pp_infinity


  778. (* Internal pretty-printer functions. *)
  779. let pp_set_min_space_left state n =
  780.   if n >= 1 then
  781.     let n = pp_limit n in
  782.     state.pp_min_space_left <- n;
  783.     state.pp_max_indent <- state.pp_margin - state.pp_min_space_left;
  784.     pp_rinit state


  787. (* Initially, we have :
  788.    pp_max_indent = pp_margin - pp_min_space_left, and
  789.    pp_space_left = pp_margin. *)
  790. let pp_set_max_indent state n =
  791.   if n > 1 then
  792.     pp_set_min_space_left state (state.pp_margin - n)


  795. let pp_get_max_indent state () = state.pp_max_indent

  797. let pp_set_margin state n =
  798.   if n >= 1 then
  799.     let n = pp_limit n in
  800.     state.pp_margin <- n;
  801.     let new_max_indent =
  802.       (* Try to maintain max_indent to its actual value. *)
  803.       if state.pp_max_indent <= state.pp_margin
  804.       then state.pp_max_indent else
  805.       (* If possible maintain pp_min_space_left to its actual value,
  806.          if this leads to a too small max_indent, take half of the
  807.          new margin, if it is greater than 1. *)
  808.        Int.max (Int.max (state.pp_margin - state.pp_min_space_left)
  809.                 (state.pp_margin / 2)) 1 in
  810.     (* Rebuild invariants. *)
  811.     pp_set_max_indent state new_max_indent


  814. (** Geometry functions and types *)
  815. type geometry = { max_indent:int; margin: int}

  817. let validate_geometry {margin; max_indent} =
  818.   if max_indent < 2 then
  819.     Error "max_indent < 2"
  820.   else if margin <= max_indent then
  821.     Error "margin <= max_indent"
  822.   else Ok ()

  824. let check_geometry geometry =
  825.   match validate_geometry geometry with
  826.   | Ok () -> true
  827.   | Error _ -> false

  829. let pp_get_margin state () = state.pp_margin

  831. let pp_set_full_geometry state {margin; max_indent} =
  832.   pp_set_margin state margin;
  833.   pp_set_max_indent state max_indent;
  834.   ()

  836. let pp_set_geometry state ~max_indent ~margin =
  837.   let geometry = { max_indent; margin } in
  838.   match validate_geometry geometry with
  839.   | Error msg ->
  840.     raise (Invalid_argument ("Format.pp_set_geometry: " ^ msg))
  841.   | Ok () ->
  842.     pp_set_full_geometry state geometry

  844. let pp_safe_set_geometry state ~max_indent ~margin =
  845.   let geometry = { max_indent; margin } in
  846.   match validate_geometry geometry with
  847.   | Error _msg ->
  848.      ()
  849.   | Ok () ->
  850.     pp_set_full_geometry state geometry

  852. let pp_get_geometry state () =
  853.   { margin = pp_get_margin state (); max_indent = pp_get_max_indent state () }

  855. let pp_update_geometry state update =
  856.   let geometry = pp_get_geometry state () in
  857.   pp_set_full_geometry state (update geometry)

  859. (* Setting a formatter basic output functions. *)
  860. let pp_set_formatter_out_functions state {
  861.       out_string = f;
  862.       out_flush = g;
  863.       out_newline = h;
  864.       out_spaces = i;
  865.       out_indent = j;
  866.     } =
  867.   state.pp_out_string <- f;
  868.   state.pp_out_flush <- g;
  869.   state.pp_out_newline <- h;
  870.   state.pp_out_spaces <- i;
  871.   state.pp_out_indent <- j

  873. let pp_get_formatter_out_functions state () = {
  874.   out_string = state.pp_out_string;
  875.   out_flush = state.pp_out_flush;
  876.   out_newline = state.pp_out_newline;
  877.   out_spaces = state.pp_out_spaces;
  878.   out_indent = state.pp_out_indent;
  879. }


  882. (* Setting a formatter basic string output and flush functions. *)
  883. let pp_set_formatter_output_functions state f g =
  884.   state.pp_out_string <- f; state.pp_out_flush <- g

  886. let pp_get_formatter_output_functions state () =
  887.   (state.pp_out_string, state.pp_out_flush)


  890. (* The default function to output new lines. *)
  891. let display_newline state () = state.pp_out_string "\n" 0  1

  893. (* The default function to output spaces. *)
  894. let blank_line = String.make 80 ' '
  895. let rec display_blanks state n =
  896.   if n > 0 then
  897.   if n <= 80 then state.pp_out_string blank_line 0 n else
  898.   begin
  899.     state.pp_out_string blank_line 0 80;
  900.     display_blanks state (n - 80)
  901.   end


  904. (* The default function to output indentation of new lines. *)
  905. ‌let display_indent = display_blanks

  907. (* Setting a formatter basic output functions as printing to a given
  908.    [Stdlib.out_channel] value. *)
  909. ‌let pp_set_formatter_out_channel state oc =
  910.   state.pp_out_string <- output_substring oc;
  911.   state.pp_out_flush <- (fun () -> flush oc);
  912.   state.pp_out_newline <- display_newline state;
  913.   state.pp_out_spaces <- display_blanks state;
  914.   state.pp_out_indent <- display_indent state

  916. (*

  918.   Defining specific formatters

  920. *)

  922. let default_pp_mark_open_tag = function
  923.   | String_tag s -> "<" ^ s ^ ">"
  924.   | _ -> ""
  925. ‌let default_pp_mark_close_tag = function
  926.   | String_tag s -> "</" ^ s ^ ">"
  927.   | _ -> ""

  929. ‌let default_pp_print_open_tag = ignore
  930. ‌let default_pp_print_close_tag = ignore

  932. (* Building a formatter given its basic output functions.
  933.    Other fields get reasonable default values. *)
  934. ‌let pp_make_formatter f g h i j =
  935.   (* The initial state of the formatter contains a dummy box. *)
  936.   let pp_queue = Queue.create () in
  937.   let sys_tok =
  938.     { size = Size.unknown; token = Pp_begin (0, Pp_hovbox); length = 0 } in
  939.   Queue.add sys_tok pp_queue;
  940.   let scan_stack = Stack.create () in
  941.   initialize_scan_stack scan_stack;
  942.   Stack.push { left_total = 1; queue_elem = sys_tok } scan_stack;
  943.   let pp_margin = 78
  944.   and pp_min_space_left = 10 in
  945.   {
  946.     pp_scan_stack = scan_stack;
  947.     pp_format_stack = Stack.create ();
  948.     pp_tbox_stack = Stack.create ();
  949.     pp_tag_stack = Stack.create ();
  950.     pp_mark_stack = Stack.create ();
  951.     pp_margin = pp_margin;
  952.     pp_min_space_left = pp_min_space_left;
  953.     pp_max_indent = pp_margin - pp_min_space_left;
  954.     pp_space_left = pp_margin;
  955.     pp_current_indent = 0;
  956.     pp_is_new_line = true;
  957.     pp_left_total = 1;
  958.     pp_right_total = 1;
  959.     pp_curr_depth = 1;
  960.     pp_max_boxes = max_int;
  961.     pp_ellipsis = ".";
  962.     pp_out_string = f;
  963.     pp_out_flush = g;
  964.     pp_out_newline = h;
  965.     pp_out_spaces = i;
  966.     pp_out_indent = j;
  967.     pp_print_tags = false;
  968.     pp_mark_tags = false;
  969.     pp_mark_open_tag = default_pp_mark_open_tag;
  970.     pp_mark_close_tag = default_pp_mark_close_tag;
  971.     pp_print_open_tag = default_pp_print_open_tag;
  972.     pp_print_close_tag = default_pp_print_close_tag;
  973.     pp_queue = pp_queue;
  974.   }


  977. (* Build a formatter out of its out functions. *)
  978. let formatter_of_out_functions out_funs =
  979.   pp_make_formatter
  980.     out_funs.out_string
  981.     out_funs.out_flush
  982.     out_funs.out_newline
  983.     out_funs.out_spaces
  984.     out_funs.out_indent


  987. (* Make a formatter with default functions to output spaces,
  988.   indentation, and new lines. *)
  989. let make_formatter output flush =
  990.   let ppf = pp_make_formatter output flush ignore ignore ignore in
  991.   ppf.pp_out_newline <- display_newline ppf;
  992.   ppf.pp_out_spaces <- display_blanks ppf;
  993.   ppf.pp_out_indent <- display_indent ppf;
  994.   ppf


  997. (* Make a formatter writing to a given [Stdlib.out_channel] value. *)
  998. let formatter_of_out_channel oc =
  999.   make_formatter (output_substring oc) (fun () -> flush oc)


  1002. (* Make a formatter writing to a given [Buffer.t] value. *)
  1003. let formatter_of_buffer b =
  1004.   make_formatter (Buffer.add_substring b) ignore


  1007. (* Allocating buffer for pretty-printing purposes.
  1008.    Default buffer size is pp_buffer_size or 512.
  1009. *)
  1010. let pp_buffer_size = 512
  1011. let pp_make_buffer () = Buffer.create pp_buffer_size

  1013. (* The standard (shared) buffer. *)
  1014. let stdbuf = pp_make_buffer ()

  1016. (* Predefined formatters standard formatter to print
  1017.    to [Stdlib.stdout], [Stdlib.stderr], and {!stdbuf}. *)
  1018. let std_formatter = formatter_of_out_channel Stdlib.stdout
  1019. and err_formatter = formatter_of_out_channel Stdlib.stderr
  1020. and str_formatter = formatter_of_buffer stdbuf

  1022. (* Initialise domain local state *)
  1023. module DLS = Domain.DLS

  1025. let stdbuf_key = DLS.new_key pp_make_buffer
  1026. let _ = DLS.set stdbuf_key stdbuf

  1028. let str_formatter_key = DLS.new_key (fun () ->
  1029.   formatter_of_buffer (DLS.get stdbuf_key))
  1030. let _ = DLS.set str_formatter_key str_formatter

  1032. let buffered_out_string key str ofs len =
  1033.   Buffer.add_substring (Domain.DLS.get key) str ofs len

  1035. let buffered_out_flush oc key () =
  1036.   let buf = Domain.DLS.get key in
  1037.   let len = Buffer.length buf in
  1038.   let str = Buffer.contents buf in
  1039.   output_substring oc str 0 len ;
  1040.   Stdlib.flush oc;
  1041.   Buffer.clear buf

  1043. let std_buf_key = Domain.DLS.new_key (fun () -> Buffer.create pp_buffer_size)
  1044. let err_buf_key = Domain.DLS.new_key (fun () -> Buffer.create pp_buffer_size)

  1046. let std_formatter_key = DLS.new_key (fun () ->
  1047.   let ppf =
  1048.     pp_make_formatter (buffered_out_string std_buf_key)
  1049.       (buffered_out_flush Stdlib.stdout std_buf_key) ignore ignore ignore
  1050.   in
  1051.   ppf.pp_out_newline <- display_newline ppf;
  1052.   ppf.pp_out_spaces <- display_blanks ppf;
  1053.   ppf.pp_out_indent <- display_indent ppf;
  1054.   Domain.at_exit (pp_print_flush ppf);
  1055.   ppf)
  1056. let _ = DLS.set std_formatter_key std_formatter

  1058. let err_formatter_key = DLS.new_key (fun () ->
  1059.   let ppf =
  1060.     pp_make_formatter (buffered_out_string err_buf_key)
  1061.       (buffered_out_flush Stdlib.stderr err_buf_key) ignore ignore ignore
  1062.   in
  1063.   ppf.pp_out_newline <- display_newline ppf;
  1064.   ppf.pp_out_spaces <- display_blanks ppf;
  1065.   ppf.pp_out_indent <- display_indent ppf;
  1066.   Domain.at_exit (pp_print_flush ppf);
  1067.   ppf)
  1068. let _ = DLS.set err_formatter_key err_formatter

  1070. let get_std_formatter () = DLS.get std_formatter_key
  1071. let get_err_formatter () = DLS.get err_formatter_key
  1072. let get_str_formatter () = DLS.get str_formatter_key
  1073. let get_stdbuf () = DLS.get stdbuf_key

  1075. (* [flush_buffer_formatter buf ppf] flushes formatter [ppf],
  1076.    then returns the contents of buffer [buf] that is reset.
  1077.    Formatter [ppf] is supposed to print to buffer [buf], otherwise this
  1078.    function is not really useful. *)
  1079. let flush_buffer_formatter buf ppf =
  1080.   pp_flush_queue ppf ~end_with_newline:false;
  1081.   let s = Buffer.contents buf in
  1082.   Buffer.reset buf;
  1083.   s

  1085. (* Flush [str_formatter] and get the contents of [stdbuf]. *)
  1086. let flush_str_formatter () =
  1087.   let stdbuf = DLS.get stdbuf_key in
  1088.   let str_formatter = DLS.get str_formatter_key in
  1089.   flush_buffer_formatter stdbuf str_formatter

  1091. let make_synchronized_formatter output flush =
  1092.   DLS.new_key (fun () ->
  1093.     let buf = Buffer.create pp_buffer_size in
  1094.     let output' = Buffer.add_substring buf in
  1095.     let flush' () =
  1096.       output (Buffer.contents buf) 0 (Buffer.length buf);
  1097.       Buffer.clear buf;
  1098.       flush ()
  1099.     in
  1100.     make_formatter output' flush')

  1102. let synchronized_formatter_of_out_channel oc =
  1103.   make_synchronized_formatter (output_substring oc) (fun () -> flush oc)

  1105. (*
  1106.   Symbolic pretty-printing
  1107. *)

  1109. (*
  1110.   Symbolic pretty-printing is pretty-printing with no low level output.

  1112.   When using a symbolic formatter, all regular pretty-printing activities
  1113.   occur but output material is symbolic and stored in a buffer of output
  1114.   items. At the end of pretty-printing, flushing the output buffer allows
  1115.   post-processing of symbolic output before low level output operations.
  1116. *)

  1118. type symbolic_output_item =
  1119.   | Output_flush
  1120.   | Output_newline
  1121.   | Output_string of string
  1122.   | Output_spaces of int
  1123.   | Output_indent of int

  1125. type symbolic_output_buffer = {
  1126.   mutable symbolic_output_contents : symbolic_output_item list;
  1127. }

  1129. let make_symbolic_output_buffer () =
  1130.   { symbolic_output_contents = [] }

  1132. let clear_symbolic_output_buffer sob =
  1133.   sob.symbolic_output_contents <- []

  1135. let get_symbolic_output_buffer sob =
  1136.   List.rev sob.symbolic_output_contents

  1138. let flush_symbolic_output_buffer sob =
  1139.   let items = get_symbolic_output_buffer sob in
  1140.   clear_symbolic_output_buffer sob;
  1141.   items

  1143. let add_symbolic_output_item sob item =
  1144.   sob.symbolic_output_contents <- item :: sob.symbolic_output_contents

  1146. let formatter_of_symbolic_output_buffer sob =
  1147.   let symbolic_flush sob () =
  1148.     add_symbolic_output_item sob Output_flush
  1149.   and symbolic_newline sob () =
  1150.     add_symbolic_output_item sob Output_newline
  1151.   and symbolic_string sob s i n =
  1152.     add_symbolic_output_item sob (Output_string (String.sub s i n))
  1153.   and symbolic_spaces sob n =
  1154.     add_symbolic_output_item sob (Output_spaces n)
  1155.   and symbolic_indent sob n =
  1156.     add_symbolic_output_item sob (Output_indent n) in

  1158.   let f = symbolic_string sob
  1159.   and g = symbolic_flush sob
  1160.   and h = symbolic_newline sob
  1161.   and i = symbolic_spaces sob
  1162.   and j = symbolic_indent sob in
  1163.   pp_make_formatter f g h i j

  1165. (*

  1167.   Basic functions on the 'standard' formatter
  1168.   (the formatter that prints to [Stdlib.stdout]).

  1170. *)

  1172. let open_hbox v = pp_open_hbox (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1173. and open_vbox v = pp_open_vbox (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1174. and open_hvbox v = pp_open_hvbox (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1175. and open_hovbox v = pp_open_hovbox (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1176. and open_box v = pp_open_box (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1177. and close_box v = pp_close_box (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1178. and open_stag v = pp_open_stag (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1179. and close_stag v = pp_close_stag (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1180. and print_as v w = pp_print_as (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v w
  1181. and print_string v = pp_print_string (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1182. and print_bytes v = pp_print_bytes (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1183. and print_int v = pp_print_int (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1184. and print_float v = pp_print_float (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1185. and print_char v = pp_print_char (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1186. and print_bool v = pp_print_bool (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1187. and print_break v w = pp_print_break (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v w
  1188. and print_cut v = pp_print_cut (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1189. and print_space v = pp_print_space (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1190. and force_newline v = pp_force_newline (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1191. and print_flush v = pp_print_flush (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1192. and print_newline v = pp_print_newline (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1193. and print_if_newline v = pp_print_if_newline (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v

  1195. and open_tbox v = pp_open_tbox (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1196. and close_tbox v = pp_close_tbox (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1197. and print_tbreak v w = pp_print_tbreak (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v w

  1199. and set_tab v = pp_set_tab (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1200. and print_tab v = pp_print_tab (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v

  1202. and set_margin v = pp_set_margin (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1203. and get_margin v = pp_get_margin (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v

  1205. and set_max_indent v = pp_set_max_indent (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1206. and get_max_indent v = pp_get_max_indent (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v

  1208. and set_geometry ~max_indent ~margin =
  1209.   pp_set_geometry (DLS.get std_formatter_key) ~max_indent ~margin
  1210. and safe_set_geometry ~max_indent ~margin =
  1211.   pp_safe_set_geometry (DLS.get std_formatter_key) ~max_indent ~margin
  1212. and get_geometry v = pp_get_geometry (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1213. and update_geometry v = pp_update_geometry (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v

  1215. and set_max_boxes v = pp_set_max_boxes (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1216. and get_max_boxes v = pp_get_max_boxes (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1217. and over_max_boxes v = pp_over_max_boxes (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v

  1219. and set_ellipsis_text v = pp_set_ellipsis_text (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1220. and get_ellipsis_text v = pp_get_ellipsis_text (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v

  1222. and set_formatter_out_channel v =
  1223.   pp_set_formatter_out_channel (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v

  1225. and set_formatter_out_functions v =
  1226.   pp_set_formatter_out_functions (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1227. and get_formatter_out_functions v =
  1228.   pp_get_formatter_out_functions (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v

  1230. and set_formatter_output_functions v w =
  1231.   pp_set_formatter_output_functions (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v w
  1232. and get_formatter_output_functions v =
  1233.   pp_get_formatter_output_functions (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v

  1236.   pp_set_formatter_stag_functions (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1237. and get_formatter_stag_functions v =
  1238.   pp_get_formatter_stag_functions (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1239. and set_print_tags v =
  1240.   pp_set_print_tags (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1241. and get_print_tags v =
  1242.   pp_get_print_tags (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1243. and set_mark_tags v =
  1244.   pp_set_mark_tags (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1245. and get_mark_tags v =
  1246.   pp_get_mark_tags (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v
  1247. and set_tags v =
  1248.   pp_set_tags (DLS.get std_formatter_key) v


  1251. (* Convenience functions *)

  1253. let pp_print_iter ?(pp_sep = pp_print_cut) iter pp_v ppf v =
  1254.   let is_first = ref true in
  1255.   let pp_v v =
  1256.     if !is_first then is_first := false else pp_sep ppf ();
  1257.     pp_v ppf v
  1258.   in
  1259.   iter pp_v v

  1261. (* To format a list *)
  1262. let pp_print_list ?(pp_sep = pp_print_cut) pp_v ppf v =
  1263.   pp_print_iter ~pp_sep List.iter pp_v ppf v

  1265. (* To format an array *)
  1266. let pp_print_array ?(pp_sep = pp_print_cut) pp_v ppf v =
  1267.   pp_print_iter ~pp_sep Array.iter pp_v ppf v

  1269. (* To format a sequence *)
  1270. let pp_print_seq ?(pp_sep = pp_print_cut) pp_v ppf seq =
  1271.   pp_print_iter ~pp_sep Seq.iter pp_v ppf seq

  1273. (* To format free-flowing text *)
  1274. let pp_print_text ppf s =
  1275.   let len = String.length s in
  1276.   let left = ref 0 in
  1277.   let right = ref 0 in
  1278.   let flush () =
  1279.     pp_print_string ppf (String.sub s !left (!right - !left));
  1280.     incr right; left := !right;
  1281.   in
  1282.   while (!right <> len) do
  1283.     match s.[!right] with
  1284.       | '\n' ->
  1285.         flush ();
  1286.         pp_force_newline ppf ()
  1287.       | ' ' ->
  1288.         flush (); pp_print_space ppf ()
  1289.       (* there is no specific support for '\t'
  1290.          as it is unclear what a right semantics would be *)
  1291.       | _ -> incr right
  1292.   done;
  1293.   if !left <> len then flush ()

  1295. let pp_print_option ?(none = fun _ () -> ()) pp_v ppf = function
  1296. | None -> none ppf ()
  1297. | Some v -> pp_v ppf v

  1299. let pp_print_result ~ok ~error ppf = function
  1300. | Ok v -> ok ppf v
  1301. | Error e -> error ppf e

  1303. let pp_print_either ~left ~right ppf = function
  1304. | Either.Left l -> left ppf l
  1305. | Either.Right r -> right ppf r

  1307. (**************************************************************)

  1309. let compute_tag output tag_acc =
  1310.   let buf = Buffer.create 16 in
  1311.   let ppf = formatter_of_buffer buf in
  1312.   output ppf tag_acc;
  1313.   pp_print_flush ppf ();
  1314.   let len = Buffer.length buf in
  1315.   if len < 2 then Buffer.contents buf
  1316.   else Buffer.sub buf 1 (len - 2)

  1318. (**************************************************************

  1320.   Defining continuations to be passed as arguments of
  1321.   CamlinternalFormat.make_printf.

  1323.   **************************************************************)

  1325. open CamlinternalFormatBasics
  1326. open CamlinternalFormat

  1328. (* Interpret a formatting entity on a formatter. *)
  1329. let output_formatting_lit ppf fmting_lit = match fmting_lit with
  1330.   | Close_box                 -> pp_close_box ppf ()
  1331.   | Close_tag                 -> pp_close_stag ppf ()
  1332.   | Break (_, width, offset)  -> pp_print_break ppf width offset
  1333.   | FFlush                    -> pp_print_flush ppf ()
  1334.   | Force_newline             -> pp_force_newline ppf ()
  1335.   | Flush_newline             -> pp_print_newline ppf ()
  1336.   | Magic_size (_, _)         -> ()
  1337.   | Escaped_at                -> pp_print_char ppf '@'
  1338.   | Escaped_percent           -> pp_print_char ppf '%'
  1339.   | Scan_indic c              -> pp_print_char ppf '@'; pp_print_char ppf c

  1341. (* Recursively output an "accumulator" containing a reversed list of
  1342.    printing entities (string, char, flus, ...) in an output_stream. *)
  1343. (* Differ from Printf.output_acc by the interpretation of formatting. *)
  1344. (* Used as a continuation of CamlinternalFormat.make_printf. *)
  1345. let rec output_acc ppf acc = match acc with
  1346.   | Acc_string_literal (Acc_formatting_lit (p, Magic_size (_, size)), s)
  1347.   | Acc_data_string (Acc_formatting_lit (p, Magic_size (_, size)), s) ->
  1348.     output_acc ppf p;
  1349.     pp_print_as_size ppf (Size.of_int size) s;
  1350.   | Acc_char_literal (Acc_formatting_lit (p, Magic_size (_, size)), c)
  1351.   | Acc_data_char (Acc_formatting_lit (p, Magic_size (_, size)), c) ->
  1352.     output_acc ppf p;
  1353.     pp_print_as_size ppf (Size.of_int size) (String.make 1 c);
  1354.   | Acc_formatting_lit (p, f) ->
  1355.     output_acc ppf p;
  1356.     output_formatting_lit ppf f;
  1357.   | Acc_formatting_gen (p, Acc_open_tag acc') ->
  1358.     output_acc ppf p;
  1359.     pp_open_stag ppf (String_tag (compute_tag output_acc acc'))
  1360.   | Acc_formatting_gen (p, Acc_open_box acc') ->
  1361.     output_acc ppf p;
  1362.     let (indent, bty) = open_box_of_string (compute_tag output_acc acc') in
  1363.     pp_open_box_gen ppf indent bty
  1364.   | Acc_string_literal (p, s)
  1365.   | Acc_data_string (p, s)   -> output_acc ppf p; pp_print_string ppf s;
  1366.   | Acc_char_literal (p, c)
  1367.   | Acc_data_char (p, c)     -> output_acc ppf p; pp_print_char ppf c;
  1368.   | Acc_delay (p, f)         -> output_acc ppf p; f ppf;
  1369.   | Acc_flush p              -> output_acc ppf p; pp_print_flush ppf ();
  1370.   | Acc_invalid_arg (p, msg) -> output_acc ppf p; invalid_arg msg;
  1371.   | End_of_acc               -> ()

  1373. (* Recursively output an "accumulator" containing a reversed list of
  1374.    printing entities (string, char, flus, ...) in a buffer. *)
  1375. (* Differ from Printf.bufput_acc by the interpretation of formatting. *)
  1376. (* Used as a continuation of CamlinternalFormat.make_printf. *)
  1377. let rec strput_acc ppf acc = match acc with
  1378.   | Acc_string_literal (Acc_formatting_lit (p, Magic_size (_, size)), s)
  1379.   | Acc_data_string (Acc_formatting_lit (p, Magic_size (_, size)), s) ->
  1380.     strput_acc ppf p;
  1381.     pp_print_as_size ppf (Size.of_int size) s;
  1382.   | Acc_char_literal (Acc_formatting_lit (p, Magic_size (_, size)), c)
  1383.   | Acc_data_char (Acc_formatting_lit (p, Magic_size (_, size)), c) ->
  1384.     strput_acc ppf p;
  1385.     pp_print_as_size ppf (Size.of_int size) (String.make 1 c);
  1386.   | Acc_delay (Acc_formatting_lit (p, Magic_size (_, size)), f) ->
  1387.     strput_acc ppf p;
  1388.     pp_print_as_size ppf (Size.of_int size) (f ());
  1389.   | Acc_formatting_lit (p, f) ->
  1390.     strput_acc ppf p;
  1391.     output_formatting_lit ppf f;
  1392.   | Acc_formatting_gen (p, Acc_open_tag acc') ->
  1393.     strput_acc ppf p;
  1394.     pp_open_stag ppf (String_tag (compute_tag strput_acc acc'))
  1395.   | Acc_formatting_gen (p, Acc_open_box acc') ->
  1396.     strput_acc ppf p;
  1397.     let (indent, bty) = open_box_of_string (compute_tag strput_acc acc') in
  1398.     pp_open_box_gen ppf indent bty
  1399.   | Acc_string_literal (p, s)
  1400.   | Acc_data_string (p, s)   -> strput_acc ppf p; pp_print_string ppf s;
  1401.   | Acc_char_literal (p, c)
  1402.   | Acc_data_char (p, c)     -> strput_acc ppf p; pp_print_char ppf c;
  1403.   | Acc_delay (p, f)         -> strput_acc ppf p; pp_print_string ppf (f ());
  1404.   | Acc_flush p              -> strput_acc ppf p; pp_print_flush ppf ();
  1405.   | Acc_invalid_arg (p, msg) -> strput_acc ppf p; invalid_arg msg;
  1406.   | End_of_acc               -> ()

  1408. (*

  1410.   Defining [fprintf] and various flavors of [fprintf].

  1412. *)

  1414. let kfprintf k ppf (Format (fmt, _)) =
  1415.   make_printf
  1416.     (fun acc -> output_acc ppf acc; k ppf)
  1417.     End_of_acc fmt

  1419. and ikfprintf k ppf (Format (fmt, _)) =
  1420.   make_iprintf k ppf fmt

  1422. let ifprintf _ppf (Format (fmt, _)) =
  1423.   make_iprintf ignore () fmt

  1425. let fprintf ppf = kfprintf ignore ppf

  1427. let printf (Format (fmt, _)) =
  1428.   make_printf
  1429.     (fun acc -> output_acc (DLS.get std_formatter_key) acc)
  1430.     End_of_acc fmt

  1432. let eprintf (Format (fmt, _)) =
  1433.   make_printf
  1434.     (fun acc -> output_acc (DLS.get err_formatter_key) acc)
  1435.     End_of_acc fmt

  1437. let kdprintf k (Format (fmt, _)) =
  1438.   make_printf
  1439.     (fun acc -> k (fun ppf -> output_acc ppf acc))
  1440.     End_of_acc fmt

  1442. let dprintf fmt = kdprintf (fun i -> i) fmt

  1444. let ksprintf k (Format (fmt, _)) =
  1445.   let b = pp_make_buffer () in
  1446.   let ppf = formatter_of_buffer b in
  1447.   let k acc =
  1448.     strput_acc ppf acc;
  1449.     k (flush_buffer_formatter b ppf) in
  1450.   make_printf k End_of_acc fmt


  1453. let sprintf fmt = ksprintf id fmt

  1455. let kasprintf k (Format (fmt, _)) =
  1456.   let b = pp_make_buffer () in
  1457.   let ppf = formatter_of_buffer b in
  1458.   let k acc =
  1459.     output_acc ppf acc;
  1460.     k (flush_buffer_formatter b ppf) in
  1461.   make_printf k End_of_acc fmt


  1464. let asprintf fmt = kasprintf id fmt

  1466. (* Flushing standard formatters at end of execution. *)

  1468. let flush_standard_formatters () =
  1469.   pp_print_flush (DLS.get std_formatter_key) ();
  1470.   pp_print_flush (DLS.get err_formatter_key) ()

  1472. let () = at_exit flush_standard_formatters

  1474. let () = Domain.before_first_spawn (fun () ->
  1475.   flush_standard_formatters ();
  1476.   let fs = pp_get_formatter_out_functions std_formatter () in
  1477.   pp_set_formatter_out_functions std_formatter
  1478.     {fs with out_string = buffered_out_string std_buf_key;
  1479.              out_flush = buffered_out_flush Stdlib.stdout std_buf_key};

  1481.   let fs = pp_get_formatter_out_functions err_formatter () in
  1482.   pp_set_formatter_out_functions err_formatter
  1483.     {fs with out_string = buffered_out_string err_buf_key;
  1484.              out_flush = buffered_out_flush Stdlib.stderr err_buf_key};
  1485. )

One Level Up Top Level
